page.title: 09Farming
page.content: The Upland Rearing farm, like the hill sheep farm, is also a single example of its type. Its 500 acres are above the 250 metre contour line and are known locally as LINDEAN HEIGHTS. It is one of a group of farms which includes cropping farms in Berwickshire. Approximately one_quarter of its acreage is used to produce fodder crops _ winter barley, swedes, rape, tifton and grass for hay and silage. It is heavily stocked : up to 500 breeding ewes - greyfaced crossed with tups selected from a range which includes Suffolk, Bluefaced Leicester, and Blackface; and up to 300 bought-in store cattle. The staff comprises a Manager and four full _ time workers, including a shepherd. Only the manager lives on the farm. There is a full range of modern equipment and buildings.
